qas.question: What is the main cause for the bitterness in beer?
What is the main goals for the sweetness of beer?
How is the bitterness in most beers generally measured?
The acidity of what ingredient acts as a preservative in beer?
What do you call the length of time that foam is on top of beer because of carbonation?
What does beer contain that brewers desire in hops?
What is measured by the Bitterness International Units scale?

plausible_answers.text: the length of time that a foamy head created by carbonation will last.

qas.question: What type of effect do floral hops have?

context: Hops contain <b5_0>several characteristics<b5_0/> that brewers desire in beer. <a0_0>Hops<a0_0/> contribute a bitterness that balances the sweetness of the <a1_0>malt<a1_0/>; the <b6_0>bitterness of beers<b6_0/> is measured on <a2_0>the International Bitterness Units scale<a2_0/>. Hops contribute floral, citrus, and herbal aromas and flavours to beer. Hops have an <b8_0>antibiotic effect<b8_0/> that favours the activity of brewer's yeast over less desirable microorganisms and aids in "<a4_0>head retention<a4_0/>", <b7_0>the length of time that a foamy head created by carbonation will last.<b7_0/> The acidity of <a3_0>hops<a3_0/> is a preservative.
